name: Agile Development
desc: Iterative and incremental development approach focusing on customer collaboration and flexibility.
details: Agile Development is a methodology that emphasizes continuous delivery, flexibility, and collaboration. It breaks projects into small, manageable iterations, enabling faster delivery and feedback.
keyFeatures: Responding to change over following a plan

name: DevOps
desc: A set of practices that automate the processes of software delivery and infrastructure management.
details: DevOps bridges the gap between development and operations, ensuring smooth collaboration and faster delivery cycles. It promotes continuous improvement and automation of workflows.

name: Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)
desc: A set of practices that enable the rapid and reliable delivery of software.
details: CI/CD automates the software development process by continuously integrating code changes and delivering them to production. This ensures rapid and reliable deployment.

name: Microservices Architecture
desc: An architectural style that structures an application as a collection of loosely coupled services.
details: Microservices architecture breaks down applications into small, independent services. Each service focuses on a single business capability and communicates via APIs.

name: Cloud-Native Development
desc: Building and running applications specifically designed for cloud environments.
details: Cloud-native development involves leveraging cloud platforms to build scalable, reliable, and resilient applications.

name: Test-Driven Development (TDD)
desc: A software development process that relies on test cases to guide development.
details: TDD ensures software quality by writing tests before coding. It promotes clarity in requirements and improves overall code reliability.
